Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2009 07:15PM maydene wrote: I am sorry, I should of said it "feels" like there is a golfball size lump. There really isn't one, the doctor felt it and told me its just the nerves are imflamed around where the drain in my arm pit was. I guess I am just frustrated cause usually you have a pain and you can take aleve or advil but I am learning that after surgery those are a no no. Well if anyone else has any insight please let me know what I can do.
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2009 06:51PM maydene wrote: I had a bilateral Mastectomy on February 27th, the tumor was in my right breast and was 3.5cm and 3 out of 4 lymph nodes were affected. I decided on a bilateral because of family history. Everything went very well. The worst part so far about this whole thing is the drains! I had 3 drains in and the one under my right armpit is so painful! The question I have is, i have had all 3 drains removed but the pain under my right armpit is still really bad. When will this subside, and when will it stop feeling like I have a golfball imbedded in my armpitt? In the mean time is there anything I can do? Ice it? They don't give you anything and they won't give me any more painkillers. Is it true I can only use tylenol? Help!
